question: 4yr old boy presenting with cryptorchidism, sho stature & on auscultation, harsh ejection systolic murmur is heard in pulmonary area. What is the hematological abnormality found in this condition?
exp: The history given in the question is suggestive of Noonan syndrome which is associated with Juvenile Myelomelanocytic leukemia; JMML. JMML BCR/ABL negative entity Regarded as MDS/MPN syndrome Seen in children aged <= 4 years An aggressive disease characterized by proliferation of granulocytic and monocytic series. Peripheral blood: Leukocytosis with neutrophilia, monocytosis, nucleated red blood cells Bone marrow: Hypercellular with granulocytic hyperplasia; Monocytes, 5-30%; Megakaryocyte decreased; Blasts + promonocytes <20% Dysplasia, not prominent; Reticulin fibrosis Associated with Neurofibroma type 1 (NF 1) Noonan syndrome Trisomy 8 mosaicism

question: In alveolar variant of rhabdomyosarcoma, the resultant fusion protein is believed to function as
exp: In Alveolar rhabdomyosarcoma, there is frequently fusion of the FOXO1 gene to either the PAX3 or the PAX7 gene, rearrangements marked by the presence of (2; 13) or(1; 13) translocations, respectively. PAX3 is a transcription factor that initiates skeletal muscle differentiation, and it appears that the chimeric PAX3-FOXO1 fusion protein interferes with the gene expression program that drives differentiation.
